Reviews.Title: “Rooms from Hell!!”
Reviews.Author: Carolann100
Reviews.Content: Booked the Hotel Tamara for 2 persons for 3 nights in June, 2011 it cost 190 Euro for the room for the three nights. We arrived and got a taxi to Hotel Tamara which cost 12 euro this was the first rip-off - it was about a 2 minute drive. The outside of the hotel was grubby and dirty we rang the bell and went up to reception which was absolutely filthy although the Aussie guy was friendly and recommended we stay at another of their properties called the Blarney Stone - he made a call and someone came to pick us up - we had to walk back to more or less where we had arrived opposite the Central station!! The first room they showed us was on the second floor up very steep rickety stairs and was disgusting the blankets were dirty and covered in burns, we were looking unto a wall about 2 ft. away from our window. We were shocked, we weren't expecting the Ritz but for the money approximately 31 euro each we did expect CLEAN. I have travelled extensively and have stayed in basic budget rooms but this place is gross. We refused the room and were shown one next door, the sheets were clean and one bed had a duvet cover, but the blankets needed a good wash. The windows did not close and were tied up with old shoe laces and tights, the walls were painted 4 different shades of green and one wall not even finished. When we were there heat was unbearable as there were air-con at the bottom of the gap between the two buildings and the heat from them meant we were getting warm air through the window. I read reviews before booking this hotel and some were quite good describing it as "cozy" - where do these people live!! If you want a clean basic room at a reasonable price do NOT stay at either of these venues - the only thing they have going is the location and the bar staff at the Blarney Stone and locals were friendly, but hey there are hundred of hotels and hostels in this area and I'm sure any of them would be better than this. Just don't book it it really is disgusting!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY HERE....AVOID AVOID AVOID”
Reviews.Author: girlonly
Reviews.Content: I am all for budget hostels and sparse rooms, but this was DISGUSTING! horrible shared bathroom, noisy, smelly stuffy room with NO WINDOW! and 100% heard mice scratching around our room during the night! horrifically overpriced for what you actually get...should be a lot cheaper... like about Â£5 a night! I am really not fussy and have stayed in lovely plain hostels in paris, barcelona, that were cheap, clean and simple, but this was horrible....also the fact that the walls of the bedroom were covered in ripped out pages of fashion magazines was a bit wierd.. DO NOT STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and central”
Reviews.Author: jesscoate
Reviews.Content: Well, when we turned upto hotel tamara (my brother and I) I was shocked for words...I like others thought that I was in hell.... Dark stairwell, everything extremely old, beds and bedding looked older than my grandma. We decided to stay a night and see what happened. Checked the beds, no bed bugs but decided to sleep in our sleep sacks to be cautious. In the end, although it wasn#t the newest place, it was good enough to sleep the night in. You get clean towels and sheets whenever you want for free, as well as free internet and coffee/tea. The owner does harp on a lot, but he is harmless. Although I hate cats and was not impressed about the cat hanging around, it was no problems. The owner had good advice on things to do and places to eat: All in all it was cheap and good enough to rest your head. I found that the toilets and showers were always clean. So you get what you pay for, and its good enough, especially as it is so central to bars, shops and the central station. We stayed for 5 nights in the end and grew to somehow love hotel tamara

Reviews.Title: “Cozy oldfashion safe Hotel”
Reviews.Author: juble3
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Amsterdam and really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Tamara. The rooms weren't that big but they were clean and cozy and safe. The staff are really helpful and you can get a cup of tea or coffee free at any time. We loved it here and we highly recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget or just for fun.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL - this place is a MISTAKE!”
Reviews.Author: CityLiving90
Reviews.Content: The moment I stepped into reception, I knew this was a mistake. We were told at reception that there were 3 shared toilets in the building, but only 1 of them was working. Yes you heard right, one toilet for the whole hotel (say 30 ppl?). The toilet that did work was tiny and utterly disgusting. When we walked into the triple room that we had booked, we found water leaking from the ceiling. We were changed to a quad, in which the heating wasn't working. The towels we were given were all filthy. Unrelated, I saw bottle filled with urine outside one of the rooms (as a result of 2 of the 3 toilets out of order). After just 2 hours of this hell, our group left and checked into a 3* hotel down the street. All I can say is this place is just not worth the cost saving. The place is a complete nightmare. Stay away!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Marieke0
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our staying at Tamara, cheap and clean! Charming owner, playful cat and free coffe and tea! We also got free drinks at irish pub nearby and had a good party there:)

Reviews.Title: “Its not the Hilton but it does the trick!!!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaxxxChloe
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends stayed here in May 2010. We went to Amsterdam in 2009 and stayed in a really nice hotel which was miles away and cost a fortune for cabs etc. So when we turned up to hotel Tamara we were a bit shocked but for the price and location it is an ok place. 6 of us went (all girls) and none of us had anything awful to say! The "mad" guy at the reception is lovely.....very welcoming and gives you maps and even circles good coffee shops loool. If your looking for a cheap hotel/hostel place to stay right near to Dam square I would recommend this place......think me and my friends may go back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “This place is the pits”
Reviews.Author: skunkweedman
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tamara is the pits As you go though the front door the smell of cat p iss will hit you.Then you look up to climb a mountain of stairs to Reception.To be greeted by some mad old guy with a cat. You look around and know this is a mistake even before you get to your room(which could mean more stairs)...after 20 mins of small talk all done by the old man we get our key and head up more stairs to our room.The bunk bed and a single i had the single bed next to the window(needing Air) My friends god help them had the bunk beds. My bed was from the 2nd world war rusty and dipped in the middle ..I was in Hell ..Ive been going to Amsterdam for over 20 years and stayed all over this great city from 5 star to budget ...Hotel Tamara sleep on the street its cleaner

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Tamara
HotelInfo.Address: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 144, Amsterdam 8561 AS, The Netherlands
